title: Innovative, Inclusive and Inspiring Workplace!
pros: Having been at Prologis for over 10 years, I can confidently say this company has provided me with incredible career growth opportunities. From day one, I have been surrounded by talented, driven professionals who challenge and inspire me to do my best. The culture here is second to none—collaborative, innovative, and supportive of employees at all levels. Compensation has always been fair and competitive, reflecting both market standards and the value the company places on its people. Being part of the industry leader in logistics real estate has been an exciting journey, and I am proud to contribute to a company that continually strives for excellence.
cons: Hard to state anything negative- Prologis is the best!

title: Ahead of the pack
pros: The C-level leadership, including our CEO, CTO, CFO, CLO, and President, are visionary and supportive, cultivating a culture of excellence. As a founder-owned and managed company, Prologis remains deeply aligned with its core values. There is also a strong culture of giving back to our communities, which adds to the sense of purpose and fulfillment. As a global leader in real estate, Prologis is at the forefront of technology, making it an exciting place to work and grow. Highly recommend!
cons: Prologis is a Fortune 100 company with 2,500+ employees, so to thrive here, you need to be dedicated and think like a service owner. The environment is fast-paced and demanding, which can be challenging if you’re not ready to take ownership and drive results.

title: Real Culture. Amazing People.
pros: The culture here is truly special. People are kind, authentic, and genuinely invested in one another’s success. It's not uncommon to meet colleagues who’ve been here for 5, 10, even 15+ years—something that feels almost unheard of these days. That kind of longevity speaks to how much people care about the work and each other. Access to leadership is another standout—our C-suite is approachable, down to earth, and easy to talk to. It’s a highly collaborative environment where integrity and doing what’s right (especially for the planet) are more than just stated values—they’re part of the day-to-day decision-making.
cons: Like any fast-moving company, things can change quickly, and sometimes communication doesn’t always keep pace. Cross-functional alignment can occasionally be a challenge as teams navigate shifting priorities. Also, because so many people stay here long term, career movement can feel slower unless you actively seek out new opportunities or advocate for your own growth.

title: One of the Best Companies I've Ever Worked For
pros: #1 is the culture at Prologis. People are kind and generally trying their best. We work hard but we pause to have fun. I also love that each region has their own sub-culture that makes it fun to visit, learn, and collaborate. Leadership has a vision for the company and genuinely cares about its people. The company is headed in the right direction. Some of the newer departments are still in startup mode figuring things out and can be messier, but there are a lot of things to be excited about and customers are overall happy with the products/services offered. Prologis is a company that practices what it preaches. We actually, seriously, care about ESG and reducing our impact on the environment, compared to other places I've been where it looks more like greenwashing. I feel well compensated for my work, and for the most part my work/life balance is fantastic. It helps that we get lots of vacation time (that I actually feel comfortable taking) and even a few days off per year to volunteer.
cons: I would love to see more diversity in exec leadership roles (women, POC, and age) for fresh perspective. But I will say this has improved even in the few years that I've been here, and DEI is a newer group that has been established. As a global company, we have the challenge of communicating across geographies, time zones, and languages. We do a better job than even some smaller companies I've worked for, but still have some room to improve here.

The company is headed in the right direction. title: Horrible Place to Work
pros: They promote people fast if you are a part of their clique. Good work life balance if they like you.
cons: I had the worst experience working here. I was blindsided with a poor performance review and given vague, unhelpful feedback that made no sense. My boss excluded me from meetings, spoke to me poorly, and held grudges whenever I made mistakes. Leadership encouraged me to “keep improving,” and offered to mentor me only to lay me off six months later. The VP was incompetent and openly said horrible things about her employees, while showing favoritism toward men in the office. Overall, leadership is a joke unprofessional, toxic, and completely lacking in accountability. I'm not sure how my boss thinks she is a good one. No diversity either and not accpeting of different kinds of people. I was told I don't fit in

title: Best Culture period. Purpose-Driven and People-First
pros: Prologis has created a workplace that blends accountability with autonomy. The culture is hard to beat—fun, hardworking, down-to-earth, and rooted in doing the right thing. Everyone—from leadership to peers—genuinely cares about making a positive impact. We're encouraged to be ourselves, take smart risks, and support one another. It's fast-paced, but fun, and a shared sense of pride in leaving the world better than we found it. The global scope of the business adds exciting meaning to the work. You feel part of something much bigger than yourself, with real impact felt across communities.
cons: Like any high-performing environment, things move quickly. Those who prefer a slower pace or a lot of handholding may find it challenging. You’ll thrive here if you’re self-motivated and collaborative.

title: Great company for agile, hard-workers
pros: Prologis is truly a world-class organization. The CEO and Founder, Hamid is a industry visionary, helping Prologis to become the global leader in industrial real estate. He leads with a confidence and thoughtfulness that inspires. On a more micro level, the individual support is excellent. The office community is friendly and helpful, with an excellent balance of hard work and fun. If you are a strong, hard-working person, you will succeed here. Folks who are not naturally driven would likely struggle.
cons: Development work can be stressful, but that's an industry issue, not a company issue. The company is strongly focused on innovation. However, we tend to roll out initiatives before they're thoroughly tested. Instead of adopting feedback readily, it can be a painful process to provide feedback on a failed initiative during launch with leadership requesting that you "prove your case" instead of taking more formal note of feedback during early launch or testing. Too many of these processes add work without value and tasks to an already complicated workday.
pros_raw: Prologis is truly a world-class organization. The CEO and Founder, Hamid is a industry visionary, helping Prologis to become the global leader in industrial real estate. He leads with a confidence and thoughtfulness that inspires. On a more micro level, the individual support is excellent. The office community is friendly and helpful, with an excellent balance of hard work and fun. If you are a strong, hard-working person, you will succeed here. Folks who are not naturally driven would likely struggle.

Too many of these processes add work without value and tasks to an already complicated workday.

title: Energizing People and Portfolios
pros: Working at Prologis has been one of the most rewarding experiences of my career. The company truly values both its clients and employees, and that shows up in everything we do. What I appreciate most is how grounded we are in our core values of integrity, accountability, passion and teamwork while always looking ahead and embracing change. I’ve felt empowered to ask bold questions, bring new ideas forward and collaborate with incredibly thoughtful and driven teammates. The culture here is proactive, supportive and genuinely human. Prologis doesn't just talk about making an impact, we live it every day together
cons: Prologis moves at such a fast pace and sets a high bar for performance, it can take time to adjust if you're new to the industry or not used to cross-functional collaboration. The environment expects proactive thinking, which is incredibly rewarding, but also requires you to stay sharp and flexible.

Offices - The offices are all newly remodeled and provide a welcoming, unique feel that attracts top talent in the markets we serve. Inclusive - We have an incredibly diverse workforce which provides a welcoming and inclusive work environment where all voices are welcomed and heard.
cons: Challenging/Expect Constant Change - Not for everyone as we are looking for people who are willing to push themselves to maximize their potential and grow together. This is a place to create a career, not just have a job.

title: Why I Chose Prologis
pros: Prologis remains the best employer I have worked for. I started as temp nearly 12 years ago and within my first week I decided that I wanted to work for and retire from this company. Luckily they wanted me as much as I wanted them. The culture, values and commitment to excellence were evident then and continue to be so today. The sense of pride I continue to feel in our shared values - integrity, mentorship, passion, accountability, courage and teamwork - is why I stay. It is a rare opportunity to find a company that aligns so closely with one's personal values.
cons: After 12 years of employment here the pros heavily outweigh the cons. The pace for professional advancement - especially on the operations side of our business is slow and often frustrating. Opportunities for promotions are not easy to come by.

title: Talented team and forward-thinking culture
pros: I work with highly competent people who take pride in what they do. There’s a strong push to stay ahead of the technology curve, which keeps the work fresh and challenging. I’m consistently encouraged to develop new skills and explore innovative solutions—especially in the Microsoft ecosystem. Leadership is technically aware and open to modern approaches.
cons: Inter-departmental communication could be stronger. Sometimes, alignment between teams takes longer than necessary and leads to duplicated efforts or unclear responsibilities. While the intention is good, some cross-team processes could be streamlined.

title: Really impressed with this company
pros: After spending a decade in big tech, I was surprised to find a company that takes many of the great attributes and leaves the negative aspects of many other big Silicon Valley corporations (in my experience since being here 1.5 years). From the comprehensive (and fun!) multi-day, in-person onboarding trainings, to company-wide volunteer days (IMPACT Day), social events that embrace different cultures and celebrate diversity - Prologis is a company that invests in its employees. I also appreciate that it routinely asks employees what it can do better, and listens. Teams are continually driving towards excellence - whether that’s finding a more effective process or implementing new technology to help teams work smarter. But in my experience, being “human” is still valued. People lead with kindness and empathy in a way that feels really genuine. The cascading effect creates a team dynamic that is pretty rare in my experience.
cons: For those that love remote work, we’re currently in the office 3x/week (may vary based on the team). At least the snacks are good :)

title: Prologis is a great place to work!
pros: I have only been here for a couple months but the culture at Prologis is amazing! It truly feels like a connected team and everyone is very willing to help/support each other. Given the scale and size of the company, the opportunities for growth or development are endless, especially if you have a natural curiosity to explore potential solutions. The benefits package far exceeds any of my previous employers.
cons: Work from home is available and possible but given the need for significant team interaction and culture development there is limited work from home opportunities

title: High-speed, high-autonomy environment with the right balance of structure
pros: A company where you can move fast, take ownership, and still count on solid support systems.
cons: Fast-pace isn’t for everyone. Less hand-holding. Evolving processes can be tough to navigate. Workload balance can fluctuate. Not a fit for everyone.
